net.jxta.content
Interface ContentShareListener

All Superinterfaces:
EventListener
public interface ContentShareListener
extends EventListener

This interface should expose events which should be common to most/all implementations and which provide information relevant to allowing the application a mechanism by which to inform the end user of the share activity. Anything beyond this is probably better off in a provider-specific extension of this base interface

See Also:
ContentShare, ContentShareEvent, ContentProvider

Method Summary
 void shareAccessed(ContentShareEvent event)
          Event indicating that a ContentShare object has been accessed by a remote peer.
 void shareSessionClosed(ContentShareEvent event)
          For provider mechanisms using connection-oriented protocols, this event indicates that a remote client session has completed.
 void shareSessionOpened(ContentShareEvent event)
          For ContentProvider mechanisms using connection-oriented protocols, this event indicates that a remote client has initiated Content data transfer.
 

Method Detail

shareSessionOpened

void shareSessionOpened(ContentShareEvent event)
For ContentProvider mechanisms using connection-oriented protocols, this event indicates that a remote client has initiated Content data transfer. As this would typically only apply to connection-oriented implementations, it's use by the ContentProvider is optional.

Parameters:
event - event data

shareSessionClosed

void shareSessionClosed(ContentShareEvent event)
For provider mechanisms using connection-oriented protocols, this event indicates that a remote client session has completed. Completion in this sense does not indicate success or failure, simply termination of the effort. As this would typically only apply to connection-oriented implementations, it's use by the ContentProvider is optional.

Parameters:
event - event data

shareAccessed

void shareAccessed(ContentShareEvent event)
Event indicating that a ContentShare object has been accessed by a remote peer. This event is general enough that it should be supported by all ContentShare implementations, though implementations may wish to throttle the frequency of events being published to allow for more scalable performance. ContentProviders must call this method for each distinguishable remote access on a best-effort basis.

Parameters:
event - event data
